perturbation.original_text:
Each party hereto agrees that any “Nonpublic Personal Information,” as the term is defined in Regulation S-P (17 CFR 248.1 –
248.30) (“Reg S-P”), may be disclosed by a party hereunder only for the specific purpose of permitting the other party or parties to perform
services set forth in this Agreement. Each party agrees that with respect to such information, it will comply with Reg S-P and any other applicable
Federal or state regulations and that it will not disclose any Nonpublic Personal Information received in connection with this Agreement to any
party except to the extent required to carry out the services set forth in this Agreement or as required by applicable law.
perturbation.changed_text:
Each party hereto agrees that any “Nonpublic Personal Information,” as the term is defined in Regulation S-P (17 CFR 248.1 –
248.30) (“Reg S-P”), may be disclosed by a party hereunder only for the specific purpose of permitting the other party or parties to perform
services set forth in this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the text 'Each party agrees that with respect to such information, it will comply with Reg S-P and any other applicable Federal or state regulations and that it will not disclose any Nonpublic Personal Information received in connection with this Agreement to any party except to the extent required to carry out the services set forth in this Agreement or as required by applicable law.', the agreement no longer explicitly states that parties must comply with Regulation S-P regarding nonpublic personal information. This introduces a legal risk as it omits a commitment to adhere to a federal regulation designed to protect consumer financial data.

perturbation.original_text:
(viii) It will make no representations concerning a Fund other than those contained in the applicable Prospectus or in
any promotional materials or sales literature furnished to S2K by the Distributor or prepared by S2K and approved for use by the
Distributor, except as otherwise noted in this Agreement;
perturbation.changed_text: (viii) It will make no representations concerning a Fund other than those in any promotional materials or sales literature furnished to S2K by the Distributor or prepared by S2K.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'contained in the applicable Prospectus or' and 'approved for use by the Distributor, except as otherwise noted in this Agreement', S2K is no longer explicitly bound to only make representations contained within the official Prospectus or from distributor approved materials. This creates a legal contradiction with SEC regulations requiring marketing materials to be consistent with and not misleading compared to the official prospectus.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Act of 1933, Securities Exchange Act of 1934, Investment Company Act of 1940

perturbation.original_text:
(xii) The Authorized S2K Representatives will be registered representatives of S2K and subject to S2K’s supervisory
oversight in accordance with all applicable laws, rules and regulations in connection with the services provided hereunder; and
perturbation.changed_text:
(xii) The Authorized S2K Representatives will be registered representatives of S2K and subject to S2K’s supervisory
oversight.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'in accordance with all applicable laws, rules and regulations in connection with the services provided hereunder', S2K's supervisory oversight is no longer explicitly tied to legal and regulatory compliance. This introduces a legal contradiction with FINRA rules that mandate broker-dealers to maintain adequate supervisory procedures.
